column1: Cafe Ba-Ba-Reeba!////Tapas for brunch is a great breakaway from the traditional
column2: and it's a very fun and group-friendly choice! I've only been for brunch and the wait isn't bad. On a Saturday
column4: and that's plenty of time to get a head start on their sangrias on tap. Brunch comes with its own tapas menu
column5: though you can order from the standard menu. Prices are reasonable for the tapas size and quantity. Flavors are fantastic and varied. There were only a few items I wouldn't get again
column6: like the baby shrimps and grits.
